§ 1975. Jurisdiction of District Courts The district courts of the United States shall have original jurisdiction of any civil action or claim against the United States founded upon this subchapter. (Added Pub. L. 89–214, § 1(a), Sept. 29, 1965, 79 Stat. 885, § 775; renumbered § 1975, Pub. L. 102–83, § 5(a), Aug. 6, 1991, 105 Stat. 406.)
Editorial Notes Amendments1991—Pub. L. 102–83 renumbered section 775 of this title as this section.
